title: 17. Valid Anagram

children.text: is a word or phrase formed by rearranging the letters of a different word or phrase, typically using all the original letters exactly once.
s and t consist of lowercase English letters.

def is_anagram(s, t)

  false

hints: Use a hash map to count character frequencies
Two strings are anagrams if they have the same character counts

children.text: Check if two strings are anagrams by comparing character frequencies.
Count character frequencies in both strings and compare them.
Use a hash map to count characters in first string, then decrement for second string.
for c in s: count[c] = count.get(c, 0) + 1

bottom_code.GO:
func main() {
  var input string
  fmt.Scanln(&input)
  
  parts := strings.Split(input, ",")
  s := strings.Trim(parts[0], "\"")
  t := strings.Trim(parts[1], "\"")
  
  result := isAnagram(s, t)
  fmt.Println(result)
}
bottom_code.RUBY:
input = gets.strip
parts = input.split(',')
s = parts[0][1..-2]
t = parts[1][1..-2]
result = is_anagram(s, t)
puts result
bottom_code.PYTHON:
input_data = sys.stdin.read().strip()
parts = input_data.split(',')
s = parts[0][1:-1]
t = parts[1][1:-1]
result = is_anagram(s, t)
print(str(result).lower())

title: 18. Group Anagrams

children.text: , group the anagrams together. You can return the answer in
is a word or phrase formed by rearranging the letters of a different word or phrase, typically using all the original letters exactly once.
strs[i] consists of lowercase English letters only.

starter_code.RUBY:
def group_anagrams(strs)
  # Write your solution here
  []
end

solution.RUBY:
def group_anagrams(strs)
  groups = {}
  
  strs.each do |str|
    key = str.chars.sort.join
    groups[key] ||= []
    groups[key] << str
  end
  
  groups.values
end

hints: Use sorted strings as keys to group anagrams
Hash map with sorted string as key and list of anagrams as value

children.text: Group strings that are anagrams of each other into separate lists.
Up to 10,000 strings with max length 100.
Use sorted strings as keys in a hash map to group anagrams together.
Sort each string to create a key, then group strings with the same key.

bottom_code.RUBY:
input = gets.strip
strs = eval(input)
result = group_anagrams(strs)
puts result.to_s.gsub("'", '"')
bottom_code.PYTHON:
input_data = sys.stdin.read().strip()
strs = eval(input_data)
result = group_anagrams(strs)
print(str(result).replace("'", '"'))
